I believe it's D, because it's about Unit Price, not Total Price.
Regular unit Price = $100 (list unit price) * 3 (since it is 3 times 6 months) * 10% (regular price considers discount schedules) = $270 --> not considering quantity, being unit price
Customer unit price = $270 (regular price) * 20% (customer price considers additional discount) = $216
Partner unit price = $216 * 50% (partner price considers partner discount) = $108
Net unit price = $108 * (-10)% = (net unit price considers distributor discount) = $118.8
